info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 14 at 9:36AM CDT until August 15 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast South Dakota, including the following county, Day.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Friday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 934 AM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Webster, Waubay, Enemy Swim Housing, Grenville, Waubay Lake, Minnewasta Lake, Rush Lake, Waubay Wildlife Rec Area, Antelope Lake, Blue Dog Lake, Bitter Lake, Campbell Slough, Enemy Swim Lake and Lake Traverse Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT FRIDAY
